column4: I just added a second NIC to my server - a Linksys card - and then configured /etc/network/interfaces.  When I go to restart /etc/init.d/networking, I get "Don't seem to be have all the variables for eth1/inet." ??
btw you dont' need the gateway line in ehth1
are you paying attention at all !?!?!?
you wrote netmast instead of netmask
and you should remove the gateway line for eth1./
okayh do 'ip addr' and use pastebin.
lo and eth0 are listed - no eth1
Not showing up in lspci, so maybe it'sa bad card.
well if it's not in lspci then nothing can be done ;-)
OK, both Ethernet Controllers are showing up in lspci, but the system only sees eth0
paste the two lines thatg list the ethernet cards !
obviously you have to google if the drivers are there for thos cards..
